column4: When using Synaptic Package Manager, I get "cant connect to local host" error and i'm unable to update or instal new packages :(
what does failed to fetch mean?
failed to fetch is failed to get
this was happening only today.... yesterday i was able to update using the synaptic package manager...
if it is saying failed to fetch us.archive.ubuntu.com than try again later the server is prolly down
oh ok...., but it says problem on my system "Could not connect to localhost:80 (127.0.0.1). - connect (111 Connection refused)"
ive never run into that but if linux is like anything else the 80 is your port that connects you to net
but why would it try to connect to my computer rather than an ubuntu server ?
i dont know are you able to be online on that pc right now?
did you try apt-get update yet?
no... i'm not sure how to do that.... new to linux and i depend on GUI a lot
open up a terminal should be in applications than accessories when it is open type without the quotes "sudo apt-get update" and see if any errors are showed
almost same error messages. please look here... http://paste.ubuntulinux.nl/4987
thats a good question im not sure why your getting local host error sorry :(
thanx for helping...
will reebot and see...
hi, remember me? i was unable to use the synaptic updates. the problem is with some anonymous proxy that i installed on my computer by mistake
that could do it i dont use proxies so i never see things like that
any idea how to remove this proxy thing?
wish i did sorry
i dont think any problem with the archives... just some settings on my computer....
while installing java run time Environment this thing came up asking me do you want to install a anonymous proxy
